Interface BoardStyle

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BlueSteel, Jungle

    public interface BoardStyle
    The board style interface defines a strategy for creating a unique board style for the Mancala Board.
    Date Created: 11/07/2012
    Date Updated: 11/14/2012
    Version:
    1.00
    Author:
    Maxim Tiourin

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Creates and returns the default button border for this style.

      Creates and returns the highlighted button border for this style.

      Draws a board to the graphics relative to 0,0, with the given width and height.

      Draws a player label for the board with the given string at x and y, and will also draw a graphic to signify that this player is currently selected if the selected flag is true.

        void drawPitHighlight(java.awt.Graphics g,
                    int w,

        Draws a pit highlight to the graphics relative to 0,0, with the given width and height.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics context
        w - width
        h - height

      • drawPitStoneAmountString

        void drawPitStoneAmountString(java.awt.Graphics g,
                            java.lang.String amount,
                            int centerx,
                            int centery)
        Draws a stone amount string at the center of x and y, for the normal pit.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics context
        amount - the stone amount string to draw
        centerx - the center x position to draw at
        centery - the center y position to draw at

      • drawBoardMancalaScoreString

        void drawBoardMancalaScoreString(java.awt.Graphics g,
                               java.lang.String score,
                               int centerx,
                               int centery,
                               boolean addition)
        Draws a score string for the mancala pit at the center of x and y.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics context
        score - score string for pit
        centerx - the center x coordinate to draw at
        centery - the center y coordinate to draw at
        addition - boolean if this label's dimension based positioning should be added to x and y, or subtracted from them.

      • drawBoardPlayerLabel

        void drawBoardPlayerLabel(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        java.lang.String label,
                        int x,
                        int y,
                        boolean selected,
                        boolean addition)
        Draws a player label for the board with the given string at x and y, and will also draw a graphic to signify that this player is currently selected if the selected flag is true.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics context
        label - the label of the player
        x - the x coordinate to draw at
        y - the y coordinate to draw at
        selected - boolean if this label so also draw a player selection graphic.
        addition - boolean if this label's dimension based positioning should be added to x and y, or subtracted from them.

      • drawBoardTitleString

        void drawBoardTitleString(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        java.lang.String title,
                        int centerx,
                        int centery)
        Draws the board Title string in the center of the board.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics context
        title - the title of the board
        centerx - the center x coordinate of the board
        centery - the center y coordinate of the board

        void drawStone(java.awt.Graphics g,

             int h)
        Draws a stone to the graphics context at the x and y position relative to 0,0, with the given width and height.

        x - x position
        y - y position
        w - width
        h - height
